name: David Mellis
cooked: My concern about self-certification is that it’s no different from simply describing a project as open-source hardware. Why add an extra layer of formality in the form of a certification, if it doesn’t come with any additional assurances that a project actually open-sources what it claims to?
raw: My concern about self-certification is that it's no different from simply describing a project as open-source hardware. Why add an extra layer of formality in the form of a certification, if it doesn't come with any additional assurances that a project actually open-sources what it claims to?
